data.title: One of the best Sushi places in OC
data.text:
Jizake is my "go to" Sushi restaurant.  Fish is always extremely fresh, and the menu is excellent.  My absolutely favorite is the Spring Roll - try it!!!  

Also phenomenal team there that is fun and knows their regular customers very well.  It is a bit of a theatre mixed in with a great restaurant.

data.title: authentic sushi
data.text: it is a good sign when there is a line at 5 pm on a monday night.  That means the restaurant is still going strong. I have been going to Jizake for a year now. No sign of declining quality or cleanliness.  The mood/atmosphere is always upbeat.  Great selection of authentic Japanese food. Great for a to go order as well

data.title: Best sushi ever!
data.text: I have never had bad sushi here. It is amazing. Hidden away in a strip mall. Atmosphere could be a little nicer. Service is great!

data.title: Best sushi in south OC!
data.text: Went for my sons bday and I've been to many sushi restaurants in Newport and laguna and cdm- by far superior with fresh rolls, sashimi and specials- and they make birthdays special here too😍 they gave my son a funny hat and glasses to wear, and there's a video screen at the sushi bar of past birthdays as they take your photo too!

data.title: Always fantastic!
data.text: We love Jizake. Consistently good sushi. Get there early because it fills up quick. Years ago it was our little secret. Not anymore!

data.title: Best sushi is south OC
data.text: Love, love the sushi here. It is always delicious. The restaurant is always clean and very busy so make a reservation or get there early. Great selection.

data.title: Very friendly staff that pays attention to detail.
data.text: Creative and surprising dishes.  Great choice for the adventurous.  The meals are excellent and atmosphere makes you feel at home.

data.title: Great sushi
data.text: This is a great little sushi restaurant!  Always friendly staff and the food has always been excellent!

data.title: Truly Excellent Sushi In A Completely Unassuming Location
data.text: Jizake is the go-to-place for sushi in Southern Orange County.  It rivals and exceeds other, better known Sushi restaurants in the OC, such as Gen Kai in Dana Point and Sushi Ruku  and Blue Fin in Newport Beach. The restaurant is unassuming and small, located in a strip mall near the corner of Crown Valley Parkway and Niguel Road.  However, the sushi chefs are amazing and the quality of the fish they serve is A+.  It is crowded almost every night, and gets loud when the place is packed--which seems to be always.  Consider ordering take out.  It is well worth the wait, and on a busy weekend night, probably the only reasonable alternative.

data.title: creative sushi
data.text: Joe is the sushi chef and you could just do what we do and ask him for his specialties. He's very talented. We also usually get edamame and hamachi kama (yellowtail cheek) from the kitchen.

data.title: Best sushi in Town
data.text:
I really like their SUSHI!! so fresh and excellent combinations.
my favorite the MOON LIGHT ROLLS< LOLLY POP< RAINBOW

data.title: Get the Boat!
data.text: This is a great sushi restaurant and fills up fast after it opens.  If you can't get a seat at the bar, get a table and order the Boat!  It says it is for two but it could easily feed 3-4 depending on how hungry you are.

data.title: Good food, pricey
data.text: Great Sushi. Check your bill carefully, could be padded quite a bit. The check does is not itemized and always seems priced through the roof.

data.title: Hidden Gem
data.text: My wife and I frequent this sushi restaurant which has interesting lollipop and lion king rolls to go with more common California rolls.  Also has good salmon sashimi.  In the locally competitive sushi market, this one stand out.

data.title: Great sushi & entertainment!
data.text: This place has some of the BEST sushi in Laguna Niguel & the chefs are very friendly & entertaining.They are a little pricey but it's totally worth it.Make reservations cause they get booked up fast.The sushi is colorful,very fresh & delicious

data.title: Don't go if you have a Japanese palette
data.text:
This restaurant is a local favorite.  They have a very dedicated customer base.  The food seems well received by the regular crowd.  

The staff are young and seem eager to please.  However, we arrived early and were taken to a table in the back.  We had to ask to be moved.  The smell of Pine Sol was so strong that it smelled like a bathroom.  I am glad it was clean, but they should clean much earlier in the day and air out the restaurant.  The smell conflicted with the food.

I travel to Japan one or two times a year, so my view is skewed and based on very high expectations.  So please keep my review in that context.  We had several dishes.  The sushi was one step above Ralph's self serve counter.  I ordered a combination dinner.  The chicken teriyaki was good, the vegetable tempura, although covered with thick batter (not delicate Japanese style batter) was okay.  However, the rice was absolutely awful.  I have never eaten such gluggy awful rice.  It was so bad, I was tempted to ask the chef how he could possibly serve it.  They should be ashamed to place such a dish on their table. 

I know they won't miss me because they have a strong following.  But if you have s sophisticated Japanese palette, give this place a miss.

data.title: OTT  sushi .. truly a hidden surprise!
data.text:
I was recommended this restaurant by a friend. Due to the crowds and cost,  I usually go for lunch only. Well if you want lunch this one is ONLY open Friday Saturday and Sunday. But I have to tell you it was absolutely worth the wait until Friday.! I've been a local sushi goer for years and years. I've had my local  well known favorite sushi spots, but this one tops anything around..... hands down !
It is located in a very small nondescript strip center on the northeast corner Golden Lantern and Crown Valley Parkway. Blink twice and you miss it. But the locals seem to know, as it was very crowded yesterday afternoon, Friday. It is a delectable delight.

data.title: Favorite Sushi Restaurant
data.text: My husband and I love coming here. The menu has so many options. My 2 year old loves the tofu nuggets. The fish is always fresh and all the apps and salads we've tried so far are delicious. The only downside is that they're not open daily for lunch.

data.title: Hands down BEST sushi!
data.text: I love Jizake! We go at least once a month. This is on the higher end for sushi in Orange County but so worth it. You get what you pay for! The crispy rice is my favorite. Best shishito peppers I've had. If you prefer the cooked route, the butter fish is amazing. If you have a big group, get the boat! Comes with enough food for an army and very reasonably priced, plus the presentation is great! Highly recommend to all!!

data.title: Big Japanese Flavors in a Small Suburban Town
data.text: Jizake brings the authentic flavors of Japan to this coastal community in a big way — everything on the menu is delicious!  Because this neighborhood gem is both small and popular with couples and families... be prepared to wait — the good news is if you do, you'll be glad you did.
